newsitem.title: USA: Forcenergy sets Cook Inlet purchase.
newsitem.headline: Forcenergy sets Cook Inlet purchase.

text.p: Forcenergy Inc said Tuesday it has agreed to acquire the working interests in the West McArthur River Field, in Alaska's Cook Inlet.
The company would pay $23.25 million if all the interests are acquired, spokesman Michael McNamara said. This would come from cash on hand, he said.

Forcenergy said its agreement is with Stewart Petroleum Co, owner of a 60.8 percent working interest in the field and a debtor in possession operating under Chapter 11 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code. An order has been signed by the Bankruptcy Court authorizing the transaction, Forcenergy said.

McNamara said the agreement is subject to acquiring a minimum working interest of 75 percent, adding Stewart is seeking to expand its interest by acquiring working interests from individuals holding the remaining 39.2 percent.
Forcenergy said the West McArthur River Field is now producing about 1,300 barrels of oil daily net to the 100 percent working interest from proven reserves of about 2,973,100 barrels of oil.
The company said it plans to implement a waterflood pressure maintenance program which is expected to stabilize production and increase proven reserves.

Included in the planned acquisition is Stewart Petroleum's interest in six exploratory leases, Forcenergy said. Two of the exploratory leases, in which Stewart has a 33 percent working interest, are associated with a recognized exploratory prospect with up to 100 million barrels gross unrisked potential. ((-- Jim Brumm 212-859-1710.))
